When you think of great video game remasters, you think of something like Wind Waker HD. Resident Evil 2002. The Crash N. Sane Trilogy. There's a lot more, but to summarize, Half-Life: Source is NOT on that list. In fact, quality of the "remaster" aside, it's barely even that. It's a half-baked port of Half-Life with only two major intentional changes - the lighting and skyboxes - and several glitches and bugs that severely break the game. The physics puzzles in this game no longer function as intended due to the use of Half-Life 2's engine over the original source engine, and glitches at several points in the game can often soft lock, or in my personal experience, even HARD lock your save file. Enemies are now egregiously difficult to fight; difficulty is never bad, but keep in mind the original Half-Life was already fairly difficult on the normal setting. In Half-Life: Source, that difficulty is spiked to BS levels of difficult. Enemies mowing you down from 100% health in mere seconds difficult. The only benefit this game presents is the fact that the skyboxes are no longer blurry jpegs. But compared to every other gaping flaw in this "remaster," it doesn't stack up. Play the original Half-Life instead, or, if you want a REAL remaster, Black Mesa (I personally recommend both, to be frank).

Игра забагованна! Неужели за столько лет нельзя было исправить глюки?.. Из того, что я заметил: 
Визуальные артефакты типа размытого каскадом изображения при движении камеры. Трупы больше не плавают. Отсутствие текстуры на месте плевка Гонарча (появляется просто черный квадрат), но это пол беды. Главная проблема, которая влияет непосредственно на геймплей - это кривые хитбоксы. Вортигонтам не по всем частям тела наносится урон. Вертолет - отдельная песня, урон проходит только по небольшой точке в районе крыла, по всем остальным местам выстрелы пролетают насквозь. По телу Нихиланта далеко не все оружие наносит урон, можно потратить весь боекомплект глюонной пушки не причинив вреда, ракетница работает, но если нет снарядов, то прыгай в портал.
Это старый добрый Half Life, но с какими-то новыми, доселе невиданными, багами, которые влияют на геймплей и в определенной ситуации могут сделать игру непроходимой.
Com toda certeza é um dos maiores marcos na historia dos games, eu não consigo imaginar a reação das pessoas em 1998 com uma aventura com essa narrativa incrível, só joguem.

Possibly the worst way to experience Half Life 1, an absolute classic. It's by no means horrible, it's certainly playable and it's still fun because, yknow, it's still Half Life, but the source engine's lighting and physics change the feel of a lot of it and make it feel more akin to playing a Gmod session than taking in Half Life as you're supposed to. A lot of bugs too, nothing game breaking as far as I've seen but they definitely ruin a lot of great moments if it's your first time. If you've played half life before it's kind of a fun gimmick to have ragdoll physics and everything, and it's nice to be able to mount this to Gmod and SFM (we wouldn't have Half Life VR But The AI Is Self Aware without this!). If you want to experience Half Life, just get the original, and if you want a more modern/updated version of Half Life, get Black Mesa.

Only buy it if you’re a collector or never played the original, otherwise Black Mesa is a better bet as a remake of the original Half-Life.

On the other hand, historically Half-Life generated a solid modding community, so you may want to check what’s available and use this Source version as a primer.

In its “vanilla” state, I’d highlight the following features:
- Improved textures.
- Neat feature that allows you to start the game on any chapter.
- Huge improvement on water reflections.
- Physics can be considered an improvement, although it may take a while getting used to, especially older players already used with the original movement dynamics.
- No auto-aim.

As much as I love Half-Life, I really recommend getting the original Half-Life 1 instead if you do not own it yet, and here's why:

While this "remaster" is on Valve's better engine, Source, it is lazily ported and has some experience-affecting issues. This version has some problems and bugs that will kind of ruin the intended Half-Life experience. Sure, there are some aspects of the game that are better than the original Half-Life, such as lighting, ragdolls, better skyboxes, etc.

However along with these features also come particular bugs. There are parts in the game that breaks your experience visually, some AI responses are broken, music cuts out once a new map loads, and there are times when the new textures just don't really help at all, and make the experience worse.

TL;DR, there is not much difference in this version of Half-Life despite being called a remaster, and along a few better features come bad glitches and bugs as well.

If you have already played the original Half-Life 1 and would like a re-experience with little to no difference from the original, then this Source edition is for you. (it also lets you play Half-Life in GMod!)

If you are looking for a full actual remaster of Half-Life in the Source engine, check out Black Mesa, a fan-remake of Half-Life approved by Valve, available in the Steam store!
